metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3420 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in newlib in versions prior to 4.0.0. Improper overflow validation in the memory allocation functions mEMALIGn, pvALLOc, nano_memalign, nano_valloc, nano_pvalloc could case an integer overflow, leading to an allocation of a small buffer and then to a heap-based buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gcc-snapshot - 20230718-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: eslerm> fixed for newlib-4.0.0 on 2020-11-17 with aa106b29a ("malloc/nano-malloc: correctly check for out-of-bounds allocation reqs")

criterions.comment: gcc-snapshot package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20230718-1ubuntu1').
newlib package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
